publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

sourceDesc.p: A TEI file created from Ethio-SPaRe data

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5

place.settlement: wäräda Gulo Mäkäda, ṭabiya May Ṣäʿada, qušät May Ṣäʿada

note.ab: Gädam. It is considered a monastic community, but there are no monks. There are two churches at the site, May Ṣäʿada Qǝddǝst Śǝllase and May Ṣäʿada ʾArbaʿtu ʾƎnsǝsa (above), and one more deserted church building (also above).

26 Mss. and one scroll photographed: MSAE-001 “Four Gospels”; MSAE-002 “Synaxarion (March-September)”; MSAE-003 “Synaxarion (September-February)”; MSAE-004 “Four Gospels”; MSAE-005 “The Rite of the Holy Week”; MSAE-006 “The Book of the Story of the Trinity”; MSAE-007 “Vita of Täklä Haymanot”; MSAE-008 “Psalter of Dawit”; MSAE-009 “Homily on the Saviour of the World”; MSAE-010 “Vita of Täklä Haymanot, a fragment”; MSAE-011 “Story of St. Mary”; MSAE-012 “Psalter of Dawit”; MSAE-013 “Prayer of Incense”; MSAE-014 “Book of the Funeral Rite”; MSAE-015 “The Book of the Matrimony Rite”; MSAE-016 “Missal”; MSAE-017 “Synoptic Lectionary for the Year”; MSAE-018 “Miracles of Mary”; MSAE-019 “Synoptic Lectionary for the Year, Bless us, our Lord…”; MSAE-020 “Miracles of Mary”; MSAE-021 “Asmat-prayers, the Prayer of St. Mary on the Mount Golgotha”; MSAE-022 “Missal”; MSAE-023 “Missal”; MSAE-024 “Missal”; MSAE-025 “Miracles of Mary”; MSAE-026 “Vita of the Righteous of Mäṭära”.
Tābots of Trinity, Mary, Four Living Creatures, Ṣadǝqan of Baräknaha (recently introduced) (distributed between two churches).
